basics.name: Ioan Rogers
basics.label: Perl Developer & Systems Administrator
basics.summary: Developer with 5 years experience in Perl Development and 8 years in Systems Admin. Develops object-oriented Perl and PostgreSQL using containers-based architecture. Dedicated to open source development, innersourcing and the modern DevOps movement, as well as continuous deployment and microservices.

work.summary: Began assisting with legacy applications, then transitioned to an innovation focused role, driving new processes and setting standards for the rest of the business unit.
highlights: Created an easy to use search interface for a complex inventory system, using Perl and Patternfly
Lead developer of a secure signing service for company-wide usage. This was developed using Perl and Docker in a microservice architecture and some components were released as open source.
Piloted and assisted in the roll out of FreeIPA to consolidate identity services and enhance security.
Piloted the introduction of Bamboo, and setup various Docker-based projects to use continuous deployment.
Converted a proprietary web application with scaling issues to autoscale on Amazon ECS.
Migrated legacy applications to new servers in a new data center as part of a project to improve the reliability of critical internal systems.
Migrated and improved monitoring from self-hosted Nagios & Icinga to SaaS LogicMonitor.

work.summary: Refactored a proprietary CMS from multiple scripts into one modular commandline application with an improved workflow.
highlights: Added a test suite before refactoring.
Internationalised the templates using Local::MakeText
Converted from deprecated CGI to Plack + FastCGI.
Created custom Debian packages for deployment.

work.summary: Lead systems administrator of a small IT department, responsible for over 60 *nix servers. Designed and implemented improved systems in addition to the general day-to-day maintenance tasks.
highlights: Set up a new data centre in a colo in Singapore.
Implemented OpenLDAP for authentication across many Unix services.
Migrated DHCP and DNS servers for the office, adding failover.
Setting up Subversion and Trac for SCM, documentation and collaboration.
Migrating Jabber services and integrating with LDAP
Implemented Heartbeat/DRBD failover for public-facing web servers
Defined and documented new standards for operating systems and applications
Migrated the company email server from a legacy system to new hardware, adding antivirus, antispam and webmail
Introduced puppet for configuration management

work.summary: Primarily telephone-based 2nd line internal customer support and repairing PCs
highlights: Developed a PHP/MySQL system for tracking employee training to replace a spreadsheet-based system
Reduced hardware turnaround from 7-14 days to 1-2

volunteer.summary: Wrote and released a variety of Perl modules for personal projects as open source.
